designInfo.interventionModelDescription: A randomized double-blind parallel-group design was used in this placebo-controlled study. Participants were randomly assigned to receive either a single oral dose of placebo or immediate-release methylphenidate 20 mg according to a randomization schedule established by the National Institutes of Health pharmacy.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Placebo and methylphenidate oral doses were presented in identical-appearing capsules. Both participants and investigators were blinded to drug assignment.

primaryOutcomes.description: Response accuracy on the N-Back working memory task (1-Back and 3-Back conditions) measured as percentage of correct responses
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During fMRI scanning session, approximately 90 minutes post drug administration

primaryOutcomes.measure: BOLD activation in fronto-parietal control network (FPCN)
primaryOutcomes.description: Blood-oxygen-level dependent (BOLD) signal changes in FPCN regions during working memory task (3-Back vs. 1-Back contrast), measured using functional MRI
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During fMRI scanning session, approximately 90 minutes post drug administration

primaryOutcomes.measure: BOLD activation in default mode network (DMN)
primaryOutcomes.description: Blood-oxygen-level dependent (BOLD) signal changes in DMN regions during working memory task (3-Back vs. 1-Back contrast), measured using functional MRI
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During fMRI scanning session, approximately 90 minutes post drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.description: Response time in milliseconds on the N-Back working memory task (1-Back and 3-Back conditions)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During fMRI scanning session, approximately 90 minutes post drug administration

secondaryOutcomes.description: State-Trait Anxiety Inventory state subscale scores assessed at three time points: immediately post drug administration (T1), 45 minutes post drug administration (T2), and immediately after scanner removal (T3)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: T1: immediately post drug administration; T2: 45 minutes post drug administration; T3: immediately after fMRI scanning (approximately 120 minutes post drug administration)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-reported anxiety ratings during the N-Back task performance in safe and threat conditions
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During fMRI scanning session, approximately 90 minutes post drug administration
